io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.util

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.util.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The StringUtil class provides static constants and methods that are useful in dealing with messages and other strings that are exchanged between the server and the players using it.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.bukkit.ChatColor ADMINCOLOR
      The color that the server admin's name should appear in.
      static int CONSOLE_WIDTH
      The width, in characters, of the default console window.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_ADMIN_ONLY_ADMIN_NOTIFICATION
      The message that is sent to admins to inform them that a player has tried to use a command that is reserved for the admins.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_ADMIN_ONLY_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to players when they try to use a command that only the admin is allowed to use.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_ADMIN_PROTECTED_ADMIN_NOTIFICATION
      The message that is sent to admins to inform them that a player has attempted to a command on them, but that the admin was protected from the command.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_ADMIN_PROTECTED_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to players when they try to target the admin with a command that the admin is protected against.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_NOT_OP_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to players when they try to use a command that requires operator / moderator priviages on the server, but the player is not an operator.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_PLAYER_ONLY_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to the conosle when the console sends a command that can only be used by an in-game player.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_TARGET_DNE_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to players when the target player they have specified as a command argument is not online, and could not be found in any offline records.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_TARGET_OFFLINE_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to players when the target player they have specified as a command argument is not a valid, currently online player.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_TARGET_ONLY_IF_OP
      The message that is sent to players when they send a command with an attached target player, and a target player can only be used with the command if the sender has operator / moderator privialeges, but the sender does not have operator privialeges.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_TOO_FEW_ARGS_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to players when a command they have submitted did not have enough arguments sent with it.
      static java.lang.String ERROR_TOO_MANY_ARGS_MESSAGE
      The message that is sent to players when a command they have submitted had too many arguments sent with it.
      static org.bukkit.ChatColor ERRORCOLOR
      The color that error messages should appear in.
      static org.bukkit.ChatColor LOCATIONCOLOR
      The color that location coordinates should appear in.
      static org.bukkit.ChatColor NAMECOLOR
      The color that player's and command's names should appear in.
      static int PLAYER_CHAT_WIDTH
      The width, in characters, of the default player-side chat box.
      static org.bukkit.ChatColor TEXTCOLOR
      The color that all standard text should appear in.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocationString

        public static java.lang.String getLocationString(org.bukkit.Location loc)
        Gets nicely-formatted String with the coordinates and world name for a given location. This method assumes the default naming scheme for bukkit worlds, which is that the overworld will be named some arbitrary, user-defined name, that its corresponding nether world will be named that same arbitrary name suffixed by "_nether", and that its corresponding end world will be named the arbitrary name suffixed by "_the_end".
        Parameters:
        loc - the location to be formatted into a String.
        Returns:
        a formatted String of the location.

      • parseString

        public static java.lang.String parseString(java.lang.String message,
                                           CommandInstance source)
        Parses and colors a message, and substitutes any of the supported shortcuts.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be parsed.
        source - the CommandInstance object that this message is attached to.
        Returns:
        a colored and formatted version of the given message.
        See Also:
        parseText(String, ChatColor, CommandInstance)

      • parseError

        public static java.lang.String parseError(java.lang.String message,
                                          CommandInstance source)
        Parses and colors an error message, and substitutes any of the supported shortcuts.
        Parameters:
        message - the error message to be parsed.
        source - the CommandInstance object that this message is attached to.
        Returns:
        a colored and formatted version of the given error message.
        See Also:
        parseText(String, ChatColor, CommandInstance)

      • parseText

        private static java.lang.String parseText(java.lang.String message,
                                          org.bukkit.ChatColor color,
                                          CommandInstance source)
        Parses a given message, substitutes any of the supported shortcuts, and colors the message to be the given color. If the message only needs to be parsed for color, but not for instance information, then the CommandInstance parameter can be null.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to parse.
        color - the color that the plain text of this message should appear in.
        source - the CommandInstance object that this message is attached to. null if the message is not attached to any specific instance of a command.
        Returns:
        a colored and formatted version of the given message.
        See Also:
        parseStringForColor(String, ChatColor)

      • parseStringForInstance

        private static java.lang.String parseStringForInstance(java.lang.String message,
                                                       org.bukkit.ChatColor color,
                                                       CommandInstance source)
        Parses a given message for supported shortcuts, and substitutes in relevant information from the source and context of a command.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to parse.
        color - the color that the plain text of this message should appear in.
        source - the CommandInstance that this message is attached to. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the message with expanded instance information.
        See Also:
        parseText(String, ChatColor, CommandInstance)

      • getSenderLocation

        private static java.lang.String getSenderLocation(CommandInstance source)
        Gets a colored, formatted string representing the location of the sender of a command. If the command was not sent by a player, the string "[no location]" will be returned. The returned string will be colored an appropriate color.
        Parameters:
        source - the CommandInstance of the given command.
        Returns:
        a formatted string for the location of the command sender.

      • getTargetLocation

        private static java.lang.String getTargetLocation(CommandInstance source)
        Gets a colored, formatted string representing the location of the player targeted by a command. If the command has no attached target player, the string "[no location]" will be returned. The returned string will be colored an appropriate color.
        Parameters:
        source - the CommandInstance of the given command.
        Returns:
        a formatted string for the location of the command sender.

      • parseStringForColor

        private static java.lang.String parseStringForColor(java.lang.String message,
                                                    org.bukkit.ChatColor color)
        Parse a given message for color keys, and color the message appropriately.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be parsed.
        color - the color that the "@default" tag should be expanded to.
        Returns:
        the recolored message.
